New Records: The Dodgers achieved their largest shutout victory margin in postseason history with a 9-0 win in the NLCS opener.
Key Match Events: Shohei Ohtani hit a three-run home run in the eighth inning.
Enrique Hernandez homered to left center in the sixth inning.
Max Muncy homered to the right to add the final score of the night.
Walker Buehler struck out Francisco Lindor with a full-count knuckle curve to leave the bases loaded in the second inning.
Pre-Game Insights: Tonight’s game will be the 10th time these teams meet this season. The Dodgers lead the series 6-3.
Post-Match Reflections: Mets manager Carlos Mendoza said his team had to respond in Game 2.
The result proves why the Dodgers were the first in the NL West during the regular season.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Dodgers silenced the 43,883 Citi Field crowd after pitching their fourth shutout in the past five playoff games in Game 3.
Others: The Mets need more action from Pete Alonso, who leads the team with 34 home runs and a .459 batting average.
Game 4 of the series is tonight in Citi Field at 8:08 p.m. (Fox) where the Mets are looking for their revenge.
